content:
It seems you have created a website and want to include a link in your emails to that website. Has the website gone live ? If yes, then it might be useful to know what you are putting in the link data.

  • In a new Write message, type some text and then insert a link.
  • Click on 'Insert' and select 'Link'
  • In small box type the text you want to display such as 'My Website'
  • then enter the 'Link location' info which is something like this: http://www.anje.co.uk

Before you click on OK - post an image to show what it is you entering in the Link Properties window. So we know there are no errors at that point.

Are you trying to create a link in the content of the email or are you trying to create a signature which includes a link to your website? I'm asking because inserting a link into an email content is not necessarilly the same process as you would use when creating a signature.

If you have an email with link and you click on 'Send' - how do you know it has not been sent ? Do you have a copy in your Sent folder ? Do you get a pop up error or a mailor daemon email saying not delivered etc? If yes, then please post an image of that error as the information may be helpful.

content:
1. Right click on attachment and select 'Open' 2. Select 'Open With' and click on 'Browse' 3. Choose program eg: Open Office Writer and click on 'OK' 4. Select checkbox for 'Do this automatically for files like this from now on' and then click on 'OK'

This info then gets added to 'Settings' > 'General' under 'Files & Attachments'.

See image as guide below. If you post in an English forum and you do not know English - Please use Google Translate.

Русский

1. Щёлкните правой кнопкой мыши по вложению и выберите «Открыть». 2. Выберите «Открыть с помощью» и нажмите «Обзор». 3. Выберите программу, например, Open Office Writer, и нажмите «ОК». 4. Установите флажок «Выполнять это автоматически для таких файлов в дальнейшем» и нажмите «ОК».

Эта информация затем добавляется в раздел «Настройки» > «Общие» в разделе «Файлы и вложения».

См. изображение ниже в качестве руководства.

Если вы пишете на англоязычном форуме и не знаете английский язык, воспользуйтесь Google Translate.

content:
Thanks for image. It explains what is going on. I notice the attachment is not a .odt attachment. Look carefully at the name there is no dot before the odt.

In my example....payoff.odt when I look at the email source it says: Content-Type: application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.text

But yours says : Content-Type: application/octet-stream

That means it's a binary file and the content is a raw stream of bytes. It doesn't provide any specific information about the type of data. Notice the image also shows this being inserted in the name of file before the odt ... %86%20%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%88%D0%B8%20 The dots imply there may be more but limited space does not show all.

HTML Encoding Reference URL-encoding  : ASCII Character %86  : † %20  : space %D0  : Ð %BD  : ½ %D0  : Ð %B0  : ° %D1  : Ñ %88  : ˆ %D0  : Ð %B8  : ¸ %20  : space

This is why you would need to save the file and then correct the extension by renaming file to say: .odt Then you be able to open using suitable program.

If you have trouble opening an attachment using 'Open with' because it just says you have to Save. Look carefully at the extension to see if the dot has been included.


Русский


Спасибо за изображение. Оно объясняет, в чём дело. Я заметил, что вложение не в формате .odt. Внимательно посмотрите на имя: перед odt нет точки.

В моём примере... payoff.odt Когда я смотрю на исходный файл письма, там написано: Content-Type: application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.text

Но у вас написано: Content-Type: application/octet-stream

Это означает, что это двоичный файл, а его содержимое — необработанный поток байтов. Он не предоставляет никакой конкретной информации о типе данных.

Обратите внимание, что на изображении также показано, как это вставляется в имя файла перед odt ... %86%20%D0%BD%D0%B0%D1%88%D0%B8%20 Точки указывают на то, что их может быть больше, но ограниченное пространство не позволяет показать всё.

Справочник по кодировке HTML Кодировка URL: Символ ASCII %86 : † %20 : пробел %D0 : Ð %BD : ½ %D0 : Ð %B0 : ° %D1 : Ñ %88 : ˆ %D0 : Ð %B8 : ¸ %20 : пробел

Вот почему вам нужно сохранить файл, а затем исправить расширение, переименовав его, например, в .odt. Тогда вы сможете открыть его в подходящей программе.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Do be careful when you get incorrect file names, sometimes they are executables - programs which you may not want to run.

Maybe the sender downloaded a file from a browser and the file name was not checked before they sent to you.

Будьте внимательны, если получаете неправильные имена файлов: иногда это исполняемые файлы — программы, которые вы, возможно, не хотите запускать.

Возможно, отправитель загрузил файл из браузера, и имя файла не было проверено перед отправкой вам.

content:
It looks like your Outlook accounts aren’t connecting in Thunderbird. Here’s what you can try:

  1. Check Outlook’s Status: There might be issues on Microsoft’s end. Check here.
  2. Update Thunderbird: Make sure you’re using the latest version.
  3. Verify Server Settings: Double-check your IMAP/SMTP settings here.
  4. App Password: If using 2FA, try creating an app-specific password.
  5. Disable Security Software: Temporarily turn off firewalls or antivirus to check if they’re blocking the connection.

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

can you provide a link to the support topic on the github site?

When you go to the download site with a browser. Click this link https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/send-later-3/ Click the download button. This should save a file "send_later-10.7.2-tb.xpi" to your downloads folders. In Thunderbird go to the addons and themes tab Click the gear icon on the top tight of the tab. Select install addon from a file from the menu.

Does this issue still occur? I ask, because the download software makes a request for the latest XPI file for the addon. First we need to check that is what is being offered, ie send_later-10.7.2-tb.xpi. Essentially this process is the same as using the automatic download and install, but I have found just sometime is works differently.

If you still had the error Open the error console in Thunderbird (ctrl+Shift+J) use the trash can on it's toolbar to clear everything from the console. try the install again. What appeared in the error console for this action? I would assume there is something about the file/ addon being incompatible.

content:
Just an FYI. AOL is Yahoo, so I doubt you are communicating successfully with yahoo addresses either. More FYI. DKIM and SPF and essentially newer technologies adopted or being adopted by most major providers to largely prevent exactly what you are doing using an email address that is not "connected" with the sending servers. ie BT email on Google.

The process for you is as simple as adding another new outgoing server to your list of outgoing servers. The from can be changed in the compose window via dropdown list above the To: and the identities for the account are used to populate that list.

So once you have the new SMTP server added go into your account settings and on the first page above the Server settings you will see a button on the bottom right "manage Identities". Every account has one and that is the information shown on that page. Name email outgoing server etc. Click on manage identities and add a new one specially crafted for you AOL correspondent (so make sure to select the correct SMTP server)

Because you will be wanting to pick the correct SMTP identity on sending, you will probably want to uniquely enter your name somehow. So instead of for instance Paul make it Paul for AOL or PaulB. Picking the right one from a list of two Pauls is not going to work I don't think and the list only shows the display name and email address. Just be aware the name used will be who the outgoing mail appears to be from (display name) so keep it clean and concise :)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi,

to customize the toolbar in Thunderbird:

Right-click on an empty space next to the Search bar in the toolbar.

Select Customize… (Toolbar) from the context menu.

A window will appear showing all available buttons and the current toolbar layout. You can drag and drop buttons to add, remove, or rearrange them.

When you’re done, click Done to save your changes.

This is the quickest way to restore missing buttons like Send, Attach, or any other tools you use frequently.
creator: KAMI911

content:
To expand on that response from KAMI, toolbar customization is context sensitive so right clicking anywhere in the below screen will achieve a lack of a send button. This is only available in the compose window context.

What is missing in this screen is anyway to get to the compose window to right click on anything without using the menu bar File> new> message or the shortcut Ctrl+N. You appear to have closed the folder pane header with the compose button on it and I think you will really do better with the one click access to compose new mail. View menu > Folders > folder pane header

If you do not like using that header there is also a write that can be added to the main toolbar as you have added reply forward and junk. I have a fairly heavily customized toolbar.

Once you have entered a compose window. Then you can follow the right click instructions from KAMI

content:
Hallo Rose Beauty,

es klingt wirklich ärgerlich, dass Sie keine E-Mails von Discord erhalten, obwohl Sie schon die Adressen auf die Whitelist gesetzt haben. Manchmal kann es helfen, auch im Spam- oder Junk-Ordner nachzuschauen oder eine alternative E-Mail-Adresse zu versuchen, falls Sie eine haben.

Falls das weiterhin nicht funktioniert, könnten Sie den Support noch einmal mit allen Details (welche E-Mail-Adresse Sie verwenden, welche Schritte Sie schon ausprobiert haben) anschreiben. Es gibt auch den Fall, dass E-Mail-Provider bestimmte Nachrichten blockieren, deshalb wäre eventuell ein Wechsel des E-Mail-Dienstes (z. B. zu Gmail oder Outlook) eine Lösung.

Ich wünsche Ihnen, dass Sie bald wieder Zugriff auf Ihren Discord-Account haben.

Viele Grüße

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
check you providers web mail outbox/sent. Are they showing there? While IMAP account will eventually syncronise sent folders to the local machine, pop account never do. Some providers like outlook and google place copies of mail sent using their servers (it causes issues on Thunderbird as folk end up with two copies of each mail in their sent folder. SO it is worth checking it there is anything there.

Beyond that you mention invoices. If you are using accounting software, most of those are more than capable of using your SMTP server for your mail account to send mail without reference to a mail client like Thunderbird. It could be your accounting package is sending mail over and over each morning when it is started.

Just to be clear I think you will be wasting your time removing and adding Thunderbird again. About the only thing it could demonstrate is, if the issue still happens after you remove Thunderbird then Thunderbird is in the clear as to being the cause.

What happens with your system every morning. Is it turned on? Awakened from sleep? Do you have an antivirus scanning outgoing mails?

Those things could be causing issues. But my first feeling to look to the source of the invoice emails. Your customers get one every day. Is that one in Thunderbird's sent folder at all or is the invoice email coming from another source entirely.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Silvia.spoggi said
Could you please write down all the steps for importing? If I save the mbox file on a USB stick to import it onto the new one, I select the profile folder but cannot find the mbox file. Thank you, Silvia.

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, copy the mbox file into Mail/Local Folders, restart TB, find the folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.

If you use the add-on, right-click Local Folders in the Folder Pane, ImportExportTools NG, Import mbox files...

content:
CIAO! Mi chiedevo: esiste un modo per riunire backup di email, formati diversi, applicazioni diverse e più account utente in un unico software?

Attualmente:

Per i backup: Thunderbird, MailStore e alcune esportazioni manuali in formato mbox.

Per l'uso quotidiano: Outlook e la WebApp del provider.

L'idea sarebbe quella di avere un'unica applicazione che consenta di:

gestire i backup,

consultare contemporaneamente i 5 account attivi,

distinguere tra la parte online (tutti i server di posta IMAP utilizzati quotidianamente) e la parte offline (backup salvati su un disco fisico all'interno della rete locale, ben organizzati per account e data di backup, accessibili da tutti i PC Windows connessi alla rete e con accesso a quel disco).

Questo software verrebbe utilizzato contemporaneamente su più PC.

Un aspetto fondamentale è che i backup locali dovrebbero svuotare automaticamente i server online, liberando spazio senza interventi manuali.

In breve, il software dovrebbe anche gestire autonomamente lo svuotamento programmato delle caselle di posta IMAP. backup?
creator: lillettoventus

content:
Formulata così sembra quasi che tu voglia far fare ad altri il tuo lavoro :)

Comunque si, Thunderbird ha un account speciale chiamato Cartelle locali che può essere utilizzato come backup locale. Attraverso i filtri è possibile stabilire i criteri con cui copiare le mail in Cartelle locali e procedere poi all'eliminazione dell'originale. Con IMAP questa operazione si propaga automaticamente al server.

Ovviamente si tratta di configurazioni non banali e non automatiche sulle quali quindi occorre seguire procedure apposite in massima parte già disponibili sui siti di Thunderbird e Mozilla.

content: Thanks so much for looking into this for me. Yes, but what is meant by an "app password", and how do I create one, as it no longer seems to be an option on the Virgin website?
creator: dave_ashwell

content:
From https://www.virginmedia.com/help/broadband/manage-email-settings

"How to set an app password to use an email app

To set up Virgin Media email on an android or iPhone email app, you need to create a separate app password through Account settings on the My Virgin Media app.

To get the password, follow these steps:

Sign in to My Virgin Media on the app

Go to Account settings, then Account details.

Under Virgin Media Mail, tap Manage next to Manage your Virgin Media Mail app password.

Under Virgin Media Mail app password, tap Generate new App password and follow the instructions.

A new secure app password will be generated for you, you can use it in all apps that access your Virgin Media mail address. If you create a new app password, you’ll need to update all your existing apps with the new password.

Your separate app password will help make things more secure as IMAP and POP don’t use extra protection like Multi Factor Authentication.

Remember that this password is separate from your sign in details for My Virgin Media (or any Virgin Media apps). So, if you need to check your Virgin Media Mail emails through My Virgin Media or at mail.virginmedia.com, you'll still use your My Virgin Media password."

Since I don't have a Virginmedia account, I cannot confirm this.

content: Fantastic! I trawled through the Virgin Media setup procedure for the nth time and finally found the app password! I can now access my blueyonder emails again. Very many thanks.

creator: sfhowes

content:
Which means you're doing something incorrectly. Here are specific details for option two and these steps have been reliable for many on the forum:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This MUST prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
David, thank you very much. My error was in copying only the Profiles folder, not all of the Thunderbird folders.

FWIW: When I keyed %appdata% into the task bar of my wife's new Win 11 computer I got a Bing search which offered several viseos about %appdata% instead of being taken to the directory location. Apparently the latest version of Win 11 is set to search the internet instead of the directory. I got around this by using the Windows key + R to get the command line where I entered %appdata%. Google later told me the old task bar function can be restored if you go to Settings > Privacy & Security > Search Permissions and disable the "Show search highlights" option. But I haven't tried that.

content:
What do you see when using Table View ? Is the 'Recipient' column header displaying ?


re :with the outbpund stuff in Sent Item sub-folders. In 'Local Folders' special account When you send an email or 'Reply to an email which was in 'Local Folders' by default it creates a 'Sent' folder not 'Sent Items' and 'Sent' would be a top level folder not a sub folder.

I'm thinking out a load here...... It sounds like you are not using default 'Sent', so Thunderbird thinks the 'Sent Items' subfolder is a normal folder as opposed to a real 'Sent' folder. Hence using the normal settings for a normal folder displaing the FROM.

What icon is displayed to the left of the 'Sent Items' folder ? Is it just an icon of a folder ? Please upload an image showing the Folder Pane - the 'Local Folders' section so I can see what you see.

If my theory is correct then try the following and it should display correctly.

  • Using an email currently located in the 'Local Folders' account, send/forward an email to yourself.
  • This should create a 'Sent' folder in 'Local Folders' account.
  • Then move emails from 'Sent Items' into 'Sent' folder.

Do those emails in the 'Sent' folder now display the Recipient ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Usually an archive location is set up automatically. Account Settings > Copies & Folders' for the account. I would advise the following:

Pop accounts :

  • Select checkbox: 'Keep message archives in'
  • Select 'Archives Folder on' and select 'the accountname/email address'
  • Click on 'Archive Options' button to choose additional options.

IMAP accounts:

  • Select checkbox: 'Keep message archives in'
  • Select 'Other' and select correct folder eg: 'Archive on accountname/email address'

(I advise using 'Other' because servers may use a different name eg: Archive not Archives)

  • Click on 'Archive Options' button to choose additional options.

Gmail IMAP By default if you choose to Archive an email, gmail will do the following: Remove all labels and continue to store email in 'All Mail' folder. Gmail stores everything in 'All Mail' received, sent, archived, the lot.

To retrieve the email:

  • logon to gmail webmail account via a browser
  • access the 'All Mail' folder.
  • Locate the email and re-apply the appropriate label eg: Inbox.
  • In Thunderbird select 'Inbox' and it synchs with server. You should see the 'archived' email reappear.

If you want to archive gmail emails but do not want them to disappear and do not want to subscribe to 'All Mail' because it's just a complete duplicate of everything, uses space and is not an easy folder to find anything....

  • Create a folder called something like 'Archive' or 'OldStuff' etc

Then in 'Account SEttings' > 'Copies & Folders' for gmail imap account

  • Select checkbox: 'Keep message archives in'
  • Select 'Other' and select correct folder eg: 'OldStuff on gmail email address'

You find the 'Archive Options' button is disabled when it comes to gmail as you cannot set up Archive options for emails that gmail put in All Mail.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Tgas: Settings > General Scroll down to TAGS section

You can remove tags and re- enter them in order you prefer.

Tags can also be seen in details : Settings > General Scrool to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button It opens in a new tab In top search type: Tags

It will give a list of all the current Tags. Each tag has a colour and a title The label number is the order listed. Example: mailnews.tags.$label1.color value = #ff0000 which is a red colour mailnews.tags.$label1.tag name = Important

You may also see tags like this mailnews.tags.done.color value = #00d500 which is a green colour mailnews.tags.done.tag name = Done

The first 9 will use the numbers 1 to 9 in order listed.
creator: Toad-Hall
